messageBody:
On Fri, 11 May 2001, Andrew Wilkie wrote:

> public boolean loadDriver()
> {
> try
> {
> // This is where we load the driver by calling in a class through its
> // string name using the forName method.
> Class.forName("oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver");
> }
> catch (ClassNotFoundException e)
> {
> System.out.println("Unable to load Driver Class");

I'd use something like:
fail("LoadDriver: " + e.getMessage());

> }
> }
> }

This makes JUnit see the problem as an error. Stuff you simply
print is invisible to JUnit.

I only use print() for debugging tests, and for status messages when
using textui.TestRunner() (generally within longer-running tests.)
